article.headline: Salesforce.com Inc., Microsoft share gains contribute to Dow's nearly 200-point climb
article.body: Shares of Salesforce.com Inc. and Microsoft are posting positive gains Friday morning, propelling the Dow Jones Industrial Average into positive territory. Shares of Salesforce.com Inc. CRM, +2.21% and Microsoft MSFT, +2.48% are contributing to the index's intraday rally, as the Dow DJIA, +0.56% was most recently trading 195 points (0.7%) higher. Salesforce.com Inc.'s shares are up $5.16, or 2.0%, while those of Microsoft have gained $3.73, or 1.8%, combining for a roughly 58-point boost for the Dow. Other components contributing significantly to the gain include Visa V, +1.80%, UnitedHealth UNH, +1.68%, and Johnson & Johnson JNJ, +1.39%. A $1 move in any one of the 30 components of the benchmark equates to a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
